intro: Conyza gayana, commonly known as the common blueweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped leaves with rough, hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in spherical heads, which are characteristic of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Conyza gayana is also known for its ability to spread rapidly through wind-dispersed seeds.
